datafield.subfield: We report the first direct measurement of decays of the $\Lambda^+_c$ baryon involving the neutron. The analysis is performed using 567 pb$^{-1}$ of $e^+e^-$ collision data collected at $\sqrt{s}=4.599$ GeV with the BESIII detector at the BEPCII collider. We observe the decay $\Lambda^+_{c}\rightarrow n K^0_S\pi^+$ and measure the absolute branching fraction to be $\mathcal{B}({\Lambda^+_{c}\rightarrow n K^0_S\pi^+})=(1.82\pm0.23({\rm stat})\pm0.11({\rm syst}))\%$. A comparison to $\mathcal{B}({\Lambda^+_{c}\rightarrow p(\bar{K}\pi)^0})$ provides an important test of isospin symmetry and final state interactions.

00001 Simultaneous fit to $M^2_{\rm miss}$ and $M_{\pi^+\pi^-}$ of events in (a, b) the $\bar{\Lambda}_c^-$ signal region and (a$^{\prime}$, b$^{\prime}$) sideband regions. Data are shown as the dots with error bars. The long-dashed lines (blue) show the $\Lambda_c^+$ backgrounds while the dot-dashed curves (pink) show the non-$\Lambda_c^+$ backgrounds. The (red) solid curves show the total fit. The (yellow) shaded area show the MC simulated backgrounds from $\Lambda_c^+$ decay.
00000 Scatter plot of $M_{\pi^+\pi^-}$ versus $M^2_{\rm miss}$ for $\Lambda_c^+\rightarrow nK^0_S\pi^+$ observed from data.
Cai-Dian L, Wei Wang and Fu-Sheng Yu
K. K. Sharma and R. C. Verma
; Ling-Lie Chau, Hai-Yang Cheng and B. Tseng
S. Jadach, B. F. L. Ward and Z. Was
E. A. Kurav and V. S. Fadin
J. C. Chen, G. S. Huang, X. R. Qi, D. H. Zhang, Y. S. Zhu
In the calculation, we assume that the processes with K0 L and K0 S included have the same branching fractions
